Chapter 18, Section 8: The Attainment of Nothingness
ÅšÄriputra!

The perfection of generosity is not the self and is also not scattered and lost, and the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The four meditations are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, and the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The eight liberations are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, and the eight superior [spheres of] perception, nine successive [degrees of] concentration, and ten universal bases are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The four establishments of mindfulness are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, and the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The door of liberation of emptiness is not the self and is also not scattered and lost, the door of liberation of signlessness and wishlessness is not the self and is also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The five eyes are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, the six supernormal knowledges are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The ten powers of a buddha are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
Omniscience is not the self and is also not scattered and lost, the cognition of the path and cognition of all aspects are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The factor of perfect enlightenment that is not subject to regression is not the self and is also not scattered and lost, the nature of always being abandoned is not the self and is also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are not the self and are also not scattered and lost, all samÄdhi gateways are not the self and are also not scattered and lost.ğŸ”½ÅšÄriputra!
ÅšÄriputra!

The ground of joy is not the self and is not scattered and lost, the ground of being stainless, the ground of light, the ground of blazing wisdom, the ground of being very difficult to conquer, the ground of manifestation, the ground of far-reaching, the ground of immovability, the ground of excellent wisdom, and the ground of the cloud of Dharma are not the self and are not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The ground of different kinds of beings is not the self and is not scattered and lost, the ground of the family, the eighth ground, the ground of complete seeing, the ground of thinness, the ground of being free from desire, the ground of having done, the ground of solitary enlightenment, the ground of bodhisattvas, and the ground of tathÄgatas are not the self and are not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The vehicle of the hearers is not the self and is not scattered and lost, the vehicle of solitary buddhas, and the Great Vehicle are not the self and are not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
All dharmas are also like this, completely without self-nature.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
All dharmas are tranquil and also not scattered and lost.
Why is it so?
because dharmas are quiescent and have the nature of non-exhaustion.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti,
What dharmas are quiescent and also not scattered and lost?
SubhÅ«ti replied,
ÅšÄriputra!
Form is quiescent and also not scattered and lost, and feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are quiescent and also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The eye sense base is quiescent and also not scattered and lost, and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are quiescent and also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!
The form sense base is quiescent and also not scattered and lost, and the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are quiescent and also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The eye element is quiescent and also not scattered and lost, and the form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition are quiescent and also not scattered and lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

The ear element is tranquil and also free from loss, the sound element, the ear consciousness element, and the ear contact, and whatever feeling arises dependent on ear contact, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, that also is tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!

The nose element is tranquil and also free from loss, the smell element, the nose consciousness element, and the nose contact, and whatever feeling arises dependent on nose contact, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, that also is tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!

The tongue element is tranquil and also free from loss, the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, and the tongue contact, and whatever feeling arises dependent on tongue contact, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, that also is tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!

The body element is tranquil and also free from loss, the touch element, the body consciousness element, and the body contact, and whatever feeling arises dependent on body contact, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, that also is tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!

The mind element is tranquil and also free from loss, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, and the mind contact, and whatever feeling arises dependent on mind contact, whether pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant, that also is tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!
The earth element is tranquil and also not lost, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are tranquil and also not lost.
ÅšÄriputra!

ÅšÄriputra!

ÅšÄriputra!

The emptiness of internal phenomena is tranquil and also free from loss, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence are also tranquil and free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!
The perfection of generosity is tranquil and also free from loss, the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, meditation, and wisdom are tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!
The four meditative concentrations are tranquil and also free from loss, the four immeasurable [minds] and the four formless concentrations are tranquil and also free from loss.
ÅšÄriputra!

ÅšÄriputra!
The peace of the factor of perfect knowledge is also without loss, and the peace of the factor of constant abiding in equanimity is also without loss.
ÅšÄriputra!
The peace of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways is also without loss, and the peace of all samÄdhi gateways is also without loss.

ÅšÄriputra!

The tranquility of the stage of different kinds of beings is also without loss, and the tranquility of the stage of the lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of complete insight, the stage of thin [desire], the stage of separation from desire, the stage of completion, the pratyekabuddha stage, the bodhisattva stage, and the TathÄgata stage are also without loss.
ÅšÄriputra!
The tranquility of the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle is also without loss, and the tranquility of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle and the Great Vehicle are also without loss.

For this reason I say:
All dharmas are also like this, completely without self-nature.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
All dharmas are also without loss in their separation.
Why is this?
Because if a dharma is separated, its nature is inexhaustible.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
What dharmas are also without loss in their separation?

The separation from the ear element is also not lost, and the separation from the sound element, ear-consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced from ear contact as a condition is also not lost.

the nose element is also far removed and not scattered, the nose consciousness element and the nose contact and the feelings that arise from nose contact are also far removed and not scattered.

the mind element is also far removed and not scattered, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element and the mind contact and the feelings that arise from mind contact are also far removed and not scattered.

the earth element is also far removed and not scattered, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are also far removed and not scattered.

All dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways are also far removed and not scattered, and all samÄdhi gateways are also far removed and not scattered.

ÅšÄriputra!
The vehicle of the hearers is also far removed and not scattered, the vehicle of pratyekabuddhas, and the Great Vehicle are also far removed and not scattered.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason I say:
All dharmas are also like this, completely without self-nature.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
The emptiness of all dharmas is also not scattered.
Why is it so?
Because if dharmas are empty, their nature is inexhaustible.

SubhÅ«ti replied,

ÅšÄriputra!

ÅšÄriputra!
form is also without aspiration and without loss, and feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are also without aspiration and without loss.
